text: is a Japanese professional football clubJsoccer.com, "Japan J.League Teams" ; retrieved 2012-7-5. in Osaka.Soccerway.com, "Cerezo Osaka"; retrieved 2012-3-2. ==History== The club was founded in 1957. * 1957-1993 Yanmar Diesel SC * 1994-present Cerezo Osaka == League title == * Japan Soccer League : 4 ** 1971, 1974, 1975, 1980 == League position == *2011 : J1 League - 12th *2012 : J1 League - 14th *2013 : J1 League - 4th *2014 : J1 League - 17th *2015 : J2 League - 4th *2016 : J2 League - 4th *2017 : J1 League - 3rd *2018 : J1 League - 7th *2019 : J1 League - 5th *2020 : J1 League - 4th == Former position == == Reserve team == Yanmar Diesel SC had reserve team ; Yanmar Club from 1976 to 1979. == Notable achievement == The team has some notable achievements. In 2010, Adriano Ferreira Martins made four goals in one game against Jubilo Iwata.WorldFootball.net, "4 Goals in one game"; retrieved 2012-7-5. In 2011, Ryuji Bando scored three goals in one game against Sanfrecce Hiroshima; and he also scored three time in a game against Shimizu S-Pulse.WorldFootball.net, "3 Goals in one game"; retrieved 2012-7-5. ==Related pages == * Sports in Japan * List of Japanese football teams * List of Cerezo Osaka players == References == ==Other websites== * http://www.cerezo.co.jp/english_top.asp ; * J.League Club Guide Category:1957 establishments in Asia Category:1950s establishments in Japan Category:Cerezo Osaka
title: Cerezo Osaka
